physical_examinations.relevant_findings: Clinical examination indicated symmetry of the face; normal mouth opening; intraoral examination revealed blanching of the throat mucosa, bilateral buccal mucosa, and palate with hardened texture and star-like striations; absent uvula; enlargement at the tongue's base; notable adhesion of the tongue's tip to the floor of the mouth; tongue soft, well-defined, dark purple hue; no signs of tenderness or numbness; nasopharyngoscopy showed elevation of the mucosa at the base of the tongue and absence of neoplasms in the hypopharynx.
physical_examinations.changes_over_time: Initially, limited mouth opening (10 mm interincisal distance) and progressive symptoms over two years; after treatment with intralesional injections, improvement in mouth opening was observed, reaching 35 mm interincisal distance three months later.
